definition: to cause trouble/to create a disturbance
variant of 鬧|闹[nao4]
noisy/cacophonous/to make noise/to disturb/to vent (feelings)/to fall ill/to have an attack (of sickness)/to go in (for some activity)/to joke
matter/thing/item/work/affair/CL:件[jian4],樁|桩[zhuang1],回[hui2]

sentences.english: The unsatisfied workers are rioting in the streets.
sentences.chinese: 心怀不满的工人们在大街上闹事。

sentences.english: He gathered a group of people and caused trouble in front of the city hall.
sentences.chinese: 他鸠集数人在市政府门口聚众闹事。

sentences.english: This is party-speak for “do not make trouble”.
sentences.chinese: 这是“不要闹事”的官方说法。

sentences.english: Tiberius Cove, said police detained 65 people involved in the day of the perpetrators.
sentences.chinese: 比留科夫表示，警方当天拘留了65名参与闹事者。

sentences.english: It's inappropriate to say he is a trouble - maker .
sentences.chinese: 说他是个闹事者是不妥当的。

sentences.english: The rioters barricaded streets with piles of blazing tires.
sentences.chinese: 闹事者用成堆燃烧着的轮胎挡住了街道。

sentences.english: Were they in for more aggro?
We were woken (or wakened) in the early hours of the morning by the shouting of the mob.
sentences.chinese: 凌晨我们被那些闹事的群众的叫喊声吵醒了。

sentences.english: creating disturbances in a public place, thus causing serious disorder in such place.
sentences.chinese: 在公共场所起哄闹事，造成公共场所秩序严重混乱的。

sentences.english: The boss thought him a trouble-maker and turned him off.
sentences.chinese: 老板认为他是个闹事者，因而把他解雇了。

sentences.english: Police in riot gear dispersed the crowd but made no arrests.
sentences.chinese: 防暴警察驱散了人群但没有逮捕闹事球迷。

sentences.english: I read him the riot act.
sentences.chinese: 我向他宣读了“取缔闹事法”。

sentences.english: It's a mob scene out there.
sentences.chinese: 外面是一片聚众闹事的景象。

sentences.english: The police have arrested these artful rascals who gathered together to make trouble.
sentences.chinese: 警方拘捕了这些聚众闹事的刁棍。

sentences.english: Rowdy mobs gathered in the leading thoroughfares.
sentences.chinese: 一群暴徒在要道聚众闹事。

sentences.english: Liang ran into a riot in a factory when she was on duty for the first time.
sentences.chinese: 梁思敏第一次当班就赶上了一起工厂闹事。

definition: to cause trouble/to provoke a dispute
to disturb/to look for trouble/to stir up a row/to bother sb intentionally
to look for trouble
to pick a quarrel/to start a fight
to cause trouble
gongs and drums overture to a Chinese opera/to create a disturbance
to cause havoc/to run amok
to break the law/to commit a crime
to look for employment/to pick a quarrel
variant of 惹是生非[re3 shi4 sheng1 fei1]
to pick fault with/to spot the differences/to nitpick/to pick a quarrel/to find complaint with
to stir up trouble
to use violence (against sb)/to strong-arm sb/to manhandle
to tell on sb/to complain (to a teacher, a superior etc)/to bring a lawsuit
disturbance/riot/to create a disturbance
variant of 找茬[zhao3 cha2]
